alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:14PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Chaffee, central Fremont and north central Custer Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 613 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Royal Gorge, or 21 miles east of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving north at 15 mph. Monsoonal moisture interacting with an outflow boundary is creating locally heavy rainfall. Radar may be underestimating rainfall amounts. HAZARD...Enhanced stream flows due to locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT... Enhanced stream flows. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Chaffee, central Fremont and north central Custer Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountain Valley Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
